topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Deploy the DBConnections Patch 034

body.p: Prerequisites: - This patch must be applied only after the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade cloud has already been deployed for all topologies (Denver/Tahoe/Memphis/Sacramento). The patch can be applied to HCG 2.0 and HCG 2.1.

This patch includes the fixes for the following issue in the standard region:
Some services failed as active connections to Mysql exceeded the allowed number.

section.title: Start the patch download
section.p: To download the patch you need from the Software Updates and Licensing site, shown above:

ol.li: Select the required patch file (e.g. ) from the Downloads list and then click Download.

Un-tar the downladed files (compressed patch files with extension tar.gz and .tar) until the apply_patch_db_connections.sh, rollback_patch_db_connections.sh and readme files are available. The readme with the patch download contains information on files changed by these patches.The Software Licensing site lists and displays patch file names individually for all the three versions of HCG ( HCG_1.1, HCG_2.0 and HCG_2.1) under Software Specification and Download filename. Regardless of their version number, these files are referencing the same files as extracted in the readme.

Check if the MD5 checksum verification file is extracted along with the patch file.
For validating the integrity of the downloaded file, you can run the MD5 checksum verification on the downloaded patch file and verify if the fingerprint of the file matches the version available on the server.

section.title: Deploying the Database Connection Patch for the lifecycle manager host

ol.li: SSH into the lifecycle manager host as the root user.

Log into the lifecycle manager VM as root.ssh <lifecycle manager_VM_IP>
where: lifecycle manager_VM_IP is the CLM IP of the lifecycle manager. Locate the IP address for the lifecycle manager in the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file under hlm_clmstaticip field.

Perform the following Steps to apply Database Connection Patch:
Copy the complete folder HCG-DBConnections under /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/patches/ directory on the lifecycle manager VM.
cd /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/patches/HCG-DBConnections.
Add necessary permissions to scripts : chmod +x *.sh
Apply patch changes: ./apply_patch_db_connections.sh
Execute the following command to integrate the changes into the environment:~/cg-hlm/hlm-build/hlm_prepare-env.sh
Run Config Processor:hlm generate -c <cloudname>
Redeploy FND-MDB role:hlm deploy -c <cloudname> -t "FND-MDB"

Perform the following steps to rollback the patch - HCG-DBConnections: cd /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/patches/HCG-DBConnections
Rollback patch changes../rollback_patch_db_connections.sh
Execute the following command to integrate the changes into the environment:~/cg-hlm/hlm-build/hlm_prepare-env.sh
Run Config Processor: hlm generate -c <cloudname>
Redeploy FND-CLU role:hlm deploy -c <cloudname> -t "FND-MDB"
